snippet: Hollywood, increasingly reliant on big-budget spectacles that make hundreds of millions of dollars, may be headed over a blockbuster cliff.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column says that Hollywood's increasing reliance on big-budget spectacles making hundreds of millions of dollars could be sending industry to inevitable blockbuster cliff; many say trend lacks imagination and fixates too much on big-budget franchise films at expense of art; upcoming summer has record number of blockbusters, 17, fighting for attention of movie goers.
lead_paragraph: Hollywood, increasingly reliant on big-budget spectacles that make hundreds of millions of dollars, may be headed over a blockbuster cliff.

headline.print_headline: The Flop Looms as Studios Lean on Blockbusters
headline.seo: As Hollywood Leans on Blockbusters, the Flop Looms
headline.main: The Flop Looms as Studios Lean on Blockbusters
